New Records: Yordan Alvarez hit three home runs, tying his career-high milestone.
Spencer Arrighetti pitched 7 2/3 innings with 11 strikeouts and 4 walks, nearly achieving a no-hitter.
Spencer Arrighetti became one of the few rookies in the Modern Era with at least 47 strikeouts and allowing no more than 19 hits in August.
Key Match Events: Jose Altuve stole home plate in the first inning, sparking the Astros' victory.
The Astros scored five runs in the fourth inning, including a two-run homer by Yordan Alvarez.
Spencer Arrighetti had a no-hitter through seven innings before allowing an infield hit.

Post-Match Reflections: Astros manager Joe Espada highlighted Jose Altuve's steal of home as a key momentum shift.
Yordan Alvarez expressed pride in the team's early energy and performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Astros avoided being swept by the Phillies and maintained a 3 1/2 game lead in the American League West with 29 games remaining.
The game was significant for the Astros' playoff push.
